title: Southeastern Indiana Battles HIV Outbreak Linked To Intravenous Drug Use
teaser: Southern Indiana is struggling to contain a rapidly spreading HIV outbreak. Poverty, administrative red tape and politics stand in the way as the number of confirmed cases continues to climb. Health policy experts are calling for a needle-exchange program to be expanded, warning that not doing so could devastate rural Indiana.
